poem:
### The Shadow of Cuts

In the cold arithmetic  
of a heartless spring,  
numbers betray  
lives unseen.  
  
Three million whispers—  
fractions of a stately sum—  
echo in hollow halls,  
fall into the depth  
where hope once bloomed.  
  
A chancellor's pen  
carves paths to deprivation,  
the poor excluded  
by sterile calculations.
